title: Schneider Electric's new research shows that digital and electric solutions can cut carbon emissions in office buildings ... - PR Newswire
summary: Retrofitting buildings using a digital-first approach is the best pathway to decarbonization. Schneider Electric's research shows digital and electric solutions can cut emissions in office buildings by up to 70%. Renovating through the deployment of digital technologies is more effective from a lifecycle carbon perspective.
green_innovation: TRUE, the article describes how digitizing buildings and electrifying heating systems reduces operational carbon emissions by up to 70%.
business_innovation: TRUE, the article describes the deployment of digital building and power management solutions in existing office buildings.
green_product: TRUE, the article describes a microgrid with local renewable energy sources that could be used to power all-electric buildings.
green_process: TRUE, the article describes replacing fossil fuel-powered heating technologies with electric-powered alternatives.
product_or_process: digital building and power management solution
likely_naics_codes: ['236220 - Commercial and Institutional Building Construction', '541330 - Engineering Services', '335312 - Motor and Generator Manufacturing', '561621 - Security Systems Services']
greenwashing: FALSE, the article is not an example of greenwashing. It provides specific, verifiable data on the environmental benefits of digitizing buildings and electrifying heating systems.
